content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy, fun, I validate!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's easy to solve, it's fun
Nice one! I would really like to play it!

The puzzle is appropriate for CoC, but the formatting isn't great and it's quite dull. I would revise the Statement to be:
--------------------
You have a class of [[n]] students. Each student is assigned a number from 1 to [[n]]. Every day, the students write their assigned number on the board as they enter the classroom, generating a list of numbers [[t]]. At the end of the day, you have to submit the attendance into the school records for each student from {{1}} to [[n]], labeling each as either "present' or "absent." The formatting is as shown in the example below.

<<Example: >>
[[n]]=8
[[t]]=7 8 5 2 1
1 is in [[t]], so print "1 is present"
2 is in [[t]], so print "2 is present"
3 is not in [[t]], so print "3 is absent"
and so on.

-----------------------------
If you adopt these changes, you should of course change the input and output fields as well.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: its pretty easy

1. Please refer to the example in the contribution guidelines to:
(a) properly present your Inputs and Outputs in terms of wordings using the terms such as Line 1, integer.
(b) properly format all variables.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

2. Please refer to point 4 of the contribution guidelines and rearrange your test cases and validators:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

3. Variable names should be consistent (you first use T and N then use t and n to refer to the same variables).

4. Constraints: please combine the two constraints on n as one.

5. In the Goal section, for clearer presentation, I think it is better to add a new line before the example.

6. Output section: suggest to use "is present" instead of "is here".

Thanks.
